title: Willem Dafoe and Robert Eggers reveal their inspirations for Nosferatu. It goes deeper than you may think.
description: Willem Dafoe and filmmaker Robert Eggers talk at-length about where they pulled their inspirations from for 'Nosferatu'. And Eggers describes how he intentionally updated the iconic character for this film.
excerpt: "I saw 'Nosferatu' when I was nine and it really ramped things up vampire-wise."
text: "I saw 'Nosferatu' when I was nine and it really ramped things up vampire-wise." Willem Dafoe and filmmaker Robert Eggers talk at-length about where they pulled their inspirations from for Nosferatu. And Eggers describes how he intentionally updated the iconic character for this film.Nosferatu opens in theaters Dec. 25. Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. html:
"I saw 'Nosferatu' when I was nine and it really ramped things up vampire-wise."

Willem Dafoe and filmmaker Robert Eggers talk at-length about where they pulled their inspirations from for Nosferatu. And Eggers describes how he intentionally updated the iconic character for this film.

Nosferatu opens in theaters Dec. 25.

Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. Based in New York City, she's an established film critic and entertainment reporter, who has traveled the world on assignment, covered a variety of film festivals, co-hosted movie-focused podcasts, interviewed a wide array of performers and filmmakers, and had her work published on RogerEbert.com, Vanity Fair, and The Guardian. A member of the Critics Choice Association and GALECA as well as a Top Critic on Rotten Tomatoes, Kristy's primary focus is movies. However, she's also been known to gush over television, podcasts, and board games. You can follow her on Twitter.
